# FluxMedia Documentation

> FluxMedia is a provider-agnostic media upload library for JavaScript and TypeScript. It provides a unified API for uploading images, videos, and files to any cloud storage provider including Cloudinary, AWS S3, and Cloudflare R2. Write your upload logic once, switch providers without changing code.

FluxMedia is available as a set of npm packages under the `@fluxmedia` scope. The core package provides the `MediaUploader` class and plugin system, while provider packages implement the `MediaProvider` interface for specific services. A React integration package provides hooks and components for client-side uploads.

- FluxMedia is *not* a storage service â€” it is a library that wraps existing providers
- All providers share the same API surface: `upload`, `delete`, `get`, `getUrl`, `uploadMultiple`, `deleteMultiple`
- Plugins extend behavior via lifecycle hooks: `beforeUpload`, `afterUpload`, `onError`, `beforeDelete`, `afterDelete`

## Docs

- [Getting Started](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/getting-started): Installation, basic usage, React integration, and multi-provider setup
- [API Reference](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/api): Complete API documentation for MediaUploader, types, errors, plugin types, and analytics events
- [Plugins](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/plugins): Official plugins (file validation, image optimization, metadata extraction, analytics, retry) and custom plugin creation
- [React Integration](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/react): useMediaUpload hook, MediaUpload component, upload modes (signed, proxy, direct), preview, and file type detection

## Providers

- [Cloudinary Provider](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/providers/cloudinary): Configuration, transformations, signed uploads, and Cloudinary-specific features
- [AWS S3 Provider](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/providers/s3): Configuration, presigned URLs, multipart uploads, and S3-specific options
- [Cloudflare R2 Provider](https://www.fluxmedia.dev/docs/providers/r2): Configuration, custom domains, and R2-specific options

## Packages

- `@fluxmedia/core`: Core types, MediaUploader class, plugin system, file type detection
- `@fluxmedia/cloudinary`: Cloudinary provider with image/video transformations
- `@fluxmedia/s3`: AWS S3 provider with presigned URL support
- `@fluxmedia/r2`: Cloudflare R2 provider (S3-compatible)
- `@fluxmedia/react`: React hooks (useMediaUpload) and components (MediaUpload)
- `@fluxmedia/plugins`: Official plugins for validation, optimization, metadata, analytics, and retry

## Optional

- [Source Code](https://github.com/codewithveek/fluxmedia): GitHub repository with full source, examples, and issue tracker
